header.title: Policies & Terms
header.subtitle: Please review our policies to understand how we operate and protect your information.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
content: Newton School is committed to protecting the privacy of our students and families. We collect only the information necessary to provide our educational services.
Personal information collected includes names, contact details, and academic records. This information is used solely for educational purposes and communication.
We do not sell, trade, or share personal information with third parties except as required by law or to provide our services.
Parents and guardians have the right to access, correct, or delete their child's information upon request.

terms.title: Terms of Service
content: By enrolling at Newton School, you agree to abide by our terms of service and policies.
Students are expected to attend classes regularly, complete assignments, and maintain respectful behavior.
Newton School reserves the right to modify these terms at any time. Changes will be communicated to enrolled families.
Continued enrollment after policy changes constitutes acceptance of the updated terms.

conduct.title: Code of Conduct
content: All students are expected to treat teachers, staff, and fellow students with respect and courtesy.
Bullying, harassment, or discrimination of any kind is strictly prohibited and may result in dismissal.
Students should come prepared for class with necessary materials and a positive attitude toward learning.
Electronic devices should be used only for educational purposes during class time.

payment.title: Payment Policy
content: Tuition payments are due by the first of each month. Late payments may incur a fee.
A deposit is required upon enrollment to secure your child's spot in the program.
Refunds are available within the first week of enrollment. After this period, tuition is non-refundable.
Payment plans are available upon request. Please discuss options with our administrative staff.

attendance.title: Attendance Policy
content: Regular attendance is essential for academic success. Please notify us of any absences in advance.
Makeup classes are available if notice is given at least 24 hours before the scheduled class.
Chronic absenteeism may affect a student's progress and eligibility for certain programs.
Tardiness disrupts the learning environment. Students should arrive at least 5 minutes before class.

safety.title: Safety Policy
content: The safety of our students is our top priority. Our facility is equipped with 24-hour CCTV monitoring.
Only authorized guardians listed in student records may pick up students. ID verification may be required.
In case of emergency, we will contact guardians immediately using the information on file.
All staff members have completed background checks and safety training.
